subject: Business
title: Growth Hacking Origins
description: A short lesson to help you apply Growth Hacking Origins.

hook.text: Sean Ellis coined 'growth hacker' in 2010 for people obsessed with one thing: growth.

buildup.text: Growth hacking uses creative, low-cost experiments instead of big marketing budgets.

discovery.text: Airbnb hacked Craigslist by letting hosts cross-post listings. Free distribution, millions of eyes.

twist.text: The term got overhyped. Every marketer rebranded as a growth hacker without changing anything.

climax.text: The real lesson survived the hype: test ruthlessly, measure everything, double down on what works.

punchline.text: Growth isn't magic. It's disciplined experimentation.

quiz.question: What is the core principle behind growth hacking?
options: Low-cost creative experiments focused on growth
